greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = T(n-1,k-1)*T(n,k-1) and T(n,1) = prime(n).
link: Index entries for triangles and arrays related to Pascal's triangle
formula: When computed as a square array A(row,col), row >= 1, col >= 1:
A(1,col) = A000040(col), for row > 1, A(row,col) = A(row-1,col)*A(row-1,col+1).
A(row,1) = A007188(row-1), for col > 1, A(row,col) = A003961(A(row,col-1)).
For all row >= 1, col >= 1, A055396(A(row,col)) = col.
example: Alternatively, this table can be viewed as a square array. Then the top left 5x4 corner looks as:
mathematica: Table[T[n, k], {n, 1, 7}, {k, 1, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 13 2017 *)
program: ;; Compute as a square array, with row >= 1, col >= 1:
(define (A066117bi row col) (if (= 1 row) (A000040 col) (* (A066117bi (- row 1) col) (A066117bi (- row 1) (+ col 1)))))
(define (A066117bi row col) (if (= 1 col) (A007188 (- row 1)) (A003961 (A066117bi row (- col 1)))))
xref: Cf. A000040, A006094 and A066116 (three leftmost diagonal of triangular table = three topmost rows of square array).
Cf. A007188, A267096 (two rightmost diagonals of the triangular table = two leftmost columns of square array).
Cf. also A099884, A255483, A276586, A276588 (other arrays derived from this one).
results.author: _Henry Bottomley_, Dec 05 2001
